image.altText: A man in a suit and tie poses with a Russian passport in front of a Russian crest.

props.synopsis: The pro-Putin propagandist hiding from authorities in the Russian consulate in Sydney, Simeon Boikov, has launched an extraordinary attack on his hosts, claiming they are subjecting him to "prison-like conditions" in a bid to "push me out".

title.children: Propagandist says his Russian hosts are trying to force him out

image.altText: The sun sets on the horizon and against a pale blue sky you see endless rows of power lines and towers.

props.synopsis: A decade and a half after an energy company CEO outlined his greatest fears for Australia's economic future — no carbon price — the nation again appears set for a renewed battle over climate policy and power generation.

title.children: What price power? How electricity became a political weapon

image.altText: A broad view of houses with solar panels on rooftop

props.synopsis: When there is an oversupply of solar and wind power, energy producers are paying more to deliver electricity to households than they get paid. Here's what we know about how it affects you.

title.children: Renewable energy generators need to cut out when sun blazes and wind blows

image.altText: Close up of Ley, not speaking

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley may be under siege, but says she has no doubts she will remain party leader until the next federal election.

title.children: Sussan Ley offers stunning guarantee she will remain Liberal leader until next election

image.altText: Murray Watt frowns at the camera.

props.synopsis: The next few days are viewed as critical to landing a deal on the proposed reforms to update the EPBC Act, amid hopes the Liberals will be more motivated to bolster their environmental credentials after ditching net zero.

title.children: Businesses urge Labor and Coalition to 'work together' on environmental reform

image.altText: Generic education school shots in a classroom with books and pencils.

props.synopsis: While some Queensland parents are angered by the nationwide recall of coloured sand that may have traces of asbestos, others are less concerned.

title.children: Parents question how sand that may contain asbestos got into schools

image.altText: A middle-aged man with grey-white hair wearing a grey T-shirt looks serious in front of a plain background.

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives is poised to take a significant step in the mammoth saga of the so-called "Epstein files". Here's how we got here.

title.children: After Trump's backflip on Epstein files vote, here's what we know

image.altText: Couple smiliing in a wedding picture, smiling at signing

props.synopsis: One year after Steven Tougher's killer was found not criminally responsible due to mental impairment, his wife says she has learnt to accept it.

title.children: Wife of slain paramedic shares message of compassion for his killer

image.altText: A close up view of a button battery held by a seven-year-old boy.

props.synopsis: The consumer group is warning parents to be wary of the dangers of button batteries in seemingly harmless products aimed at children.

title.children: Most toys bought online in Choice investigation failed safety standards

image.altText: Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain in a mohair cardigan, sitting with a semi-acoustic guitar for MTV's Unplugged.

props.synopsis: It was nearly a disaster, but Nirvana going acoustic for MTV ended up being one of the most iconic live performances ever and cemented Kurt Cobain as a tortured genius.

title.children: The night Nirvana made history — and Kurt Cobain thought he blew it

image.altText: A woman with chin length blonde hair in a grey jacket and black top stands in front of green trees.

props.synopsis: Jess Wilson, the 35-year-old Member for Kew, is seeking to make history by becoming the Victorian Liberal Party's first female leader.

title.children: First-term MP Jess Wilson poised for Victorian Liberal leadership challenge

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: The families of two young Australians who died after drinking methanol-laced drinks in Laos will be part of a new federal alcohol awareness campaign designed to help keep school leavers safe on their overseas travels. Follow live.

title.children: Parents of methanol victims launch new Schoolies alcohol awareness campaign

image.altText: An old lady walks down a street with buildings damaged by military strikes behind her.

props.synopsis: Russia enters Pokrovsk in Ukraine's east on motorcycles and in ramshackle cars with troops perched on the top, in what has been dubbed a "Mad Max-style" convoy.

title.children: Russia desperate to take strategic Ukrainian city as winter approaches

image.altText: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina is speaking in a conference

props.synopsis: A Bangladesh court has sentenced ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina to death after finding her guilty of crimes against humanity.

title.children: Bangladesh court issues death sentence against ex-PM who fled country

image.altText: A dozen sail boats make their way through the Sydney Harbour.

props.synopsis: A crew of nine set out on the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race on the Winston Churchill amid warnings of dangerous weather. Only six of them survived.

title.children: The dark past of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race

image.altText: a small old urn

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

title.children: Think you know the Ashes? Try our fiendish quiz to find out

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera while sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: Ava Costa's spinal injury sparked an outpouring of support from the gymnastics community. Now the teenager wants to ensure others can spend less time in hospital.

title.children: Former gymnast's mission to rehome disability equipment

image.altText: A 4WD vehicle parked at an amenities shed in the outback surrounded by trees and mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: A couple travelling through Central Australia have been reported as missing for the past four days. The tourists were last seen at Finke Gorge National Park near Alice Springs.

title.children: Couple travelling through Central Australia missing for four days

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: New figures show there are 50 per cent more pokies in areas with an Indigenous population of at least 10 per cent. Gambling groups say it is "not surprising".

title.children: 'Very disturbing' rate of pokies in Indigenous communities

image.altText: A large box with multiple rocks in it, which have all been catalogued.

props.synopsis: Rio Tinto may have mothballed its proposed $3.6 billion lithium project in Serbia's Jadar Valley, but opponents have vowed to keep fighting until the mining giant leaves the area for good.

title.children: Rio Tinto pauses plans for $3.7b lithium mine but Serbians still worried

image.altText: A man in cold weather gear throwing a bag out of a burnt out balcony window.

props.synopsis: Moscow is intensifying its strikes on Ukraine, targeting the country's energy infrastructure ahead of winter.

title.children: Ukraine signs 'historic' fighter jets deal as Russian strikes intensify

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: The federal government has revoked the visa of a man who attended the far-right National Socialist Network protest at NSW's parliament house.

title.children: 'Time to go home': Visa of man who attended Neo-Nazi protest revoked

image.altText: Ariana Grande arrives at the 16th Governors Awards in LA

props.synopsis: Johnson Wen, who is alleged to have disrupted other global sports events and concerts, has shown "a pattern of behaviour", according to a Singapore court judge.

title.children: Australian man who grabbed Ariana Grande at premiere jailed for nine days

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The newspaper settled a court case brought by the Groths, who sued the paper over a series of articles it published earlier this year.

title.children: Herald Sun publishes apology to Victorian MP Sam Groth and his wife

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan and the 2020 AFL draft class

props.synopsis: It is the AFL draft that has become a cautionary tale to clubs. Five years on from the infamous 2020 draft, here is the story on the tumultuous year from those involved in it.

title.children: 'A year of turmoil': Inside the AFL's infamous 2020 COVID draft

image.altText: Layne Beachley smiles

props.synopsis: Seven-time world champion Layne Beachley has received the Dawn Award at the Sport Australia Hall of Fame Awards for her efforts in improving women's surfing, while Oscar Piastri has won the annual Don Award.

title.children: Beachley and Piastri earn top gongs at Sport Australia Hall of Fame

image.altText: Man and woman stand behind a gate, in front of a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Farmers thwart VicGrid in its first attempt to use compulsory access powers to enter their properties.

title.children: Farmers defy compulsory access powers to block VicGrid staff

image.altText: A group of men walk alongside a stationary train with police tape alongside the track

props.synopsis: The track is a vital link for supplies to reach Ukraine, with the incident the latest in a wave of similar attacks across Europe since Russia's invasion began.

title.children: Railway track blast in Poland 'unprecedented act of sabotage', Polish PM says

image.altText: Toby Sutherland is wearing a Bedford jumper and smiling.

props.synopsis: Workers at disability employment provider Bedford reveal their joy at learning their jobs are secure with the announcement of a preferred buyer, following months of uncertainty.

title.children: Bedford workers relief for 'steady future' as buyer announced

image.altText: A large white and red ship docked in Hobart.

props.synopsis: When asked about TT-Line's insolvency and whether he was "aware of anything that has made them solvent again", Tasmania's auditor-general has said "the short answer is 'no'."

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania operator still insolvent, auditor-general says

image.altText: Profile of Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: The foreign minister has used a major speech to celebrate the government's string of security agreements, saying Labor has helped build a region more stable and less deferential to authoritarian powers like Russia and China.

title.children: Wong says Australia the 'architect' in the region after 'landmark' achievements

image.altText: A woman in a black and white patterned jacket talks into a microphone at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Tokyo has sent a senior foreign ministry official to Beijing to try and ease tensions, that have seen threats made against Japan's prime minister.

title.children: Japan moves to cool tensions with China amid diplomatic spat over Taiwan

image.altText: The letters BBC over the front doors to an office building

props.synopsis: The US president says he could sue the British national broadcaster for as much as $US5 billion.

title.children: BBC 'determined to fight' Trump lawsuit over documentary edit

image.altText: Horses race out of the straight

props.synopsis: The report was supposed to be released in mid October until an industry event was abruptly cancelled.

title.children: Landmark racing report missing in action as government stays quiet

image.altText: A black swan, its neck bent back along its body.

props.synopsis: An unlikely patient in Alice Springs is returned to the water treatment ponds two weeks after being found injured from a suspected dog attack.

title.children: Black swan 'Jandal' survives suspected dog attack in outback Australia
